title: How to Build an Apartment in Sims 2 Apartment Life (with Cheats)

steps.title: Decide what kind of apartment you want.
steps.content: Decide what kind of apartment you want. There are 3 different kinds of apartments you can make. They are condominiums, townhouses, and connected apartments. Condominiums are separated apartments. Townhouses are connected, but have a garage and a separate roof for each apartment. And connected apartments have a building with all the apartments inside.

steps.title: Make a lot for your apartment.
steps.content: Make a lot for your apartment. Connected apartments can be 3x3 in size, condos can be 3x4, and townhouses can be 5x2. These are just suggestions, but the sizes really make a difference.

steps.title: Enter cheats
steps.content: Enter cheats to build it. Press Ctrl, Shift and C to activate the cheat box. Type in the following cheats: changelotzoning apartmentbase boolProp aptBaseLotSpecificToolsDisabled false "changelotzoning apartmentbase" changes the lot to an apartment. You can tell if the mailbox turns into a multiple slot mailbox. boolProp aptBaseLotSpecificToolsDisabled false lets you add in doors, walls, etc.

steps.title: Start by creating the foundation (optional) and outside walls.
steps.content: Start by creating the foundation (optional) and outside walls. If you have foundation, don't forget the stairs. Avoid boxes, and don't make it too big or small! Remember, there should be 3 or 4 apartments within each lot, so make sure you have the size right.

steps.title: Add windows, a front door, and a roof.
steps.content: Add windows, a front door, and a roof. Try to put the windows all over the apartment building, or else an apartment won't get enough light. The front door can be any door except for the apartment door with the rug, or else Sims will rent the whole thing. For the roof, you can put in an actual roof or flooring. For a roof, click on the roof tool button, then drag the roof tool to where you want. You can select different styles and colors of roofs. For flooring, go to the flooring tool, then drag the floor you want across the desired area.

steps.title: Put in outside wall covering.
steps.content: Put in outside wall covering. This can be stone, brick, paneling, whatever you want. To do it faster, press Shift before you click the wall. The whole area is covered! Do this for each story of the house.

steps.title: Create the lobby.
steps.content: Create the lobby. Every apartment in Sims 2 has a lobby. On the first floor (excluding foundation), put in a medium-sized room with a fireplace, couches, tables, etc. This is the main room where your Sims can hang out. Remember, Sims 2 Apartment Life comes with vending machines!

steps.title: Make the outline walls of the apartments and add the apartment door for each one.
steps.content: Make the outline walls of the apartments and add the apartment door for each one.

steps.title: Fill in each apartment with walls, wall covering, floor covering, and basic furniture.
steps.content: Fill in each apartment with walls, wall covering, floor covering, and basic furniture. The wall trick explained earlier also works for floors. Here is a list of the basic furniture to put in each apartment: Plumbing: Sink, bathtub/shower, toilet Kitchen: Counters, stove, fridge Ceiling lights Built-in Closet

steps.title: Create the outside environment.
steps.content: Create the outside environment. This can be a garden, a fence, or a playground for the little sims. You could even add a pool! Be creative, but even a bush or two really changes the environment. Another idea is to add outdoor lamps and benches.
